item.title: Anscombe's quartet
item.description: Anscombe’s Quartet Anscombe’s quartet is a brilliant idea that shows the importance and convenience of visual representation of data. Anscombe’s quartet has four datasets. The values of each dataset are shown below. x1 = [10, 8, 13, 9, 11, 14, 6, 4, 12, 7, 5] y1 = [8.04, 6.95, 7.58, 8.81, 8.33, 9.96, 7.24, 4.26, 10.84, 4.82, 5.68] x2 = [10.0, 8.0, 13.0, 9.0, 11.0, 14.0, 6.0, 4.0, 12.0, 7.0, 5.0] y2 = [9.14, 8.14, 8.74, 8.77, 9.26, 8.1, 6.13, 3.1, 9.13, 7.26, 4.74] x3 = [10.0, 8.0, 13.0, 9.0, 11.0, 14.0, 6.0, 4.0, 12.0, 7.0, 5.0], y3 = [7.46, 6.
